commit_message:
Encode libvirt domain XML in UTF-8

Creating a VM with a non-ASCII name results in an error. Resolve
this by encoding the libvirt domain XML in utf-8.

Co-Authored-By: Yikun Jiang <yikunkero@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1730756
Change-Id: I7afce618deca3baaa96605a6b48c1c2ef4a5f2a5
(cherry picked from commit 784c0ecdc37e7a2ac5e9b5ad9de4f5d88190a7dc)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/31/542831/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # In py2 env, xml is encoded in write_instance_config use # encodeutils.safe_encode, it will be decode text before encoding if six.PY2: self.assertEqual(fake_safe_decode(fake_xml), xml) else: self.assertEqual(fake_xml, xml) orig_xml = six.text_type(mock.sentinel.orig_xml) new_xml = six.text_type(mock.sentinel.new_xml) mock_dom.XMLDesc.return_value = orig_xml mock_dom.XMLDesc.return_value = new_xml expected_xml = new_xml expected_xml = orig_xml
deleted_lines: self.assertEqual(fake_xml, xml) mock_dom.XMLDesc.return_value = mock.sentinel.orig_xml mock_dom.XMLDesc.return_value = mock.sentinel.new_xml expected_xml = mock.sentinel.new_xml expected_xml = mock.sentinel.orig_xml

subject: Tags in workflows were not being properly checked
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-07 18:35:29.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/lang/v2/workflows.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/lang/v2/test_workflows.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/mistral/commit/7c807d3d82e193403a0ab7411fb0968e6773b9df', 'message': 'Tags in workflows were not being properly checked

If an invalid tag section was specified, Mistral would throw a 500,
with no useful error message. This makes the tags get checked and

Change-Id: If2ae69ef76a857bcafe1e4b3d72956c6deeeea09
Closes-Bug: #1747950
'}]
commit_message:
Tags in workflows were not being properly checked

If an invalid tag section was specified, Mistral would throw a 500,
with no useful error message. This makes the tags get checked and
throws a proper error if so.

Change-Id: If2ae69ef76a857bcafe1e4b3d72956c6deeeea09
Closes-Bug: #1747950
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/29/541829/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_tags(self): tests = [ ({'tags': ''}, True), ({'tags': []}, True), ({'tags': ['']}, True), ({'tags': ['tag']}, False), ({'tags': ['tag', 'tag']}, True), ({'tags': None}, True) ] for wf_tags, expect_error in tests: overlay = {'test': wf_tags} self._parse_dsl_spec( add_tasks=True, changes=overlay, expect_error=expect_error )

commit_message:
Filtering networks or routers by non-existing tenants return an empty list

When networks or routers are filtered by a tenant which does not exist,
there will be return a list no filtered. But we expect an empty list.

Change-Id: I8faca01ab67240a76818d6752f796a6de3c51b5f
Closes-Bug: #1744846
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/87/536687/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # If the tenant filter selected and the tenant does not exist. # We do not need to retrieve the list from neutron,just return # an empty list. if search_opts.has_key('tenant_id') and \ not search_opts.get('tenant_id'): return []

commit_message:
Support specified security groups when creating a port

This patch allows users to specifie security groups when creating
a port. After a port is created, the backend specifies a 'default'
security group. To be consistent with this configuration, the page
initialization also defaults to a 'default' security group.

Change-Id: I13fe4648c3b5f8311602844e08044af8f7b47fd8
Closes-Bug:#1746985
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/63/540463/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - Support specifie security groups when creating a port. Only the port security is enabled, the port security groups tab will be displayed in create port workflow.

fluentbit, fluentd, node-exporter, kube-state-metrics, the
openstack exporter, and grafana.

It also adds a check for deploying a multinode osh environment
with armada

Change-Id: Ie2cb29279a7e47570b7faee82828f7ec753ab73f

commit_message:
Add checks for armada fullstack deployment

This adds a check to openstack-helm for deploying the full osh +
lma stack with armada. It deploys a manifest that will install
a rabbitmq and memcached per openstack service

Depends-On: Id58f85f150054d82c047bd360258ebe9e571360f
Change-Id: Ie2cb29279a7e47570b7faee82828f7ec753ab73f

subject: Fix logic to check for insecure Keystone
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-30 20:02:57.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/inventory/group_vars/all.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/afd89877feac8f6ae03062f594b35b81283930b4', 'message': "Fix logic to check for insecure Keystone

The logic to check for insecure Keystone would only validate if
both HAproxy and Keystone SSL is installed.  However, in the case
where SSL happens at either of those (ex. SSL at HAproxy only),
then it would still declare it as insecure (it is not however
as we're hitting the VIP which does SSL termination).

This changes the behaviour to check if the protocol is HTTPs and
either the Keystone or HAproxy certificates are defined then it
considers it as secure, otherwise it is insecure.

Manual backport of 15e2d85f4136a3bcbd9d8e1d919686a9a361e6c6 due to file
name differences and lack of 'keystone_service_publicuri*' variables.

Closes-Bug: #1745479
Co-Authored-By: Logan V <logan2211@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Mohammed Naser <mnaser@vexxhost.com>
Change-Id: I3683c5d50cab2d321337c71bed565d2e2ab861fc
"}]
commit_message:
Fix logic to check for insecure Keystone

The logic to check for insecure Keystone would only validate if
both HAproxy and Keystone SSL is installed.  However, in the case
where SSL happens at either of those (ex. SSL at HAproxy only),
then it would still declare it as insecure (it is not however
as we're hitting the VIP which does SSL termination).

This changes the behaviour to check if the protocol is HTTPs and
either the Keystone or HAproxy certificates are defined then it
considers it as secure, otherwise it is insecure.

Manual backport of 15e2d85f4136a3bcbd9d8e1d919686a9a361e6c6 due to file
name differences and lack of 'keystone_service_publicuri*' variables.

Closes-Bug: #1745479
Co-Authored-By: Logan V <logan2211@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Mohammed Naser <mnaser@vexxhost.com>
Change-Id: I3683c5d50cab2d321337c71bed565d2e2ab861fc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/05/539305/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: keystone_service_adminuri_insecure: |- {% set _insecure = false %} {% if keystone_service_adminuri_proto == 'https' %} {% set _insecure = not (keystone_user_ssl_cert is defined or haproxy_user_ssl_cert is defined) %} {% endif %} {{ _insecure }}keystone_service_internaluri_insecure: |- {% set _insecure = false %} {% if keystone_service_internaluri_proto == 'https' %} {% set _insecure = not (keystone_user_ssl_cert is defined or haproxy_user_ssl_cert is defined) %} {% endif %} {{ _insecure }}
deleted_lines: keystone_service_adminuri_insecure: "{% if keystone_service_adminuri_proto == 'https' and (keystone_user_ssl_cert is not defined or haproxy_user_ssl_cert is not defined) | bool %}true{% else %}false{% endif %}"keystone_service_internaluri_insecure: "{% if keystone_service_internaluri_proto == 'https' and (keystone_user_ssl_cert is not defined or haproxy_user_ssl_cert is not defined) | bool %}true{% else %}false{% endif %}"

commit_message:
Add earliest-version tag for releasenote

Blazar changed its release numbering 0.4.0 to 1.0.0 series in
middle of Queens cycle. It fails to include releasenotes related to
0.4.0 numbering.

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ic6aa38f3b5d9a706a2e9ab3257a81da6d72da0ee

commit_message:
Views accessible via url even if user doesn't match policy rules

When a user doesn't match the policy rules of a panel then the panel tab
is removed from the menu of the left, but panel views are still
accessible using directly the url (ex /admin/flavors/).

In most of the case, views won't work correctly because of the lack of
right in the backend, but it may cause trouble when you play with
policies.

I think it could be more elegant to return directly a "You are not
authorized to access this page" from the frontend when user try to
access a view of a panel (via url) without matching the policy rules.

Change-Id: Ia300244f358f0ad939e1d755649c41107deec53a
Closes-Bug: #1741051

used "extend" method in image_import_opts, this patch
fixes it.

commit_message:
Mark neutron-lbaas as deprecated

This patch marks the LBaaS 2.0 API, listed as part of the neutron API
reference, as deprecated and includes a note in the LBaaS API reference
that neutron-lbaas is deprecated.

Change-Id: Ibe564b62692aba786d953cedb0bd5f3817f9c238
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib refs/changes/52/539752/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ====================== LBaaS 2.0 (DEPRECATED) ====================== .. warning:: Neutron-lbaas is deprecated as of Queens. Load-Balancer-as-a-Service (LBaaS v2) is now provided by the `Octavia project <https://docs.openstack.org/octavia/latest/>`_. The `Octavia API v2 <https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/load-balancer/v2/index.html>`_ is backwards compatible with the neutron-lbaas implementation of the LBaaS 2.0 API. Please see the FAQ: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Neutron/LBaaS/Deprecation

commit_message:
sphinxext: Warn if namespace or command pattern invalid

Calling the Sphinx extension with an invalid namespace or command
pattern currently results in a silent failure. Correct this oversight by
raising a warning, which will cause a build failure is
'warning-is-error' is enabled.

Change-Id: I63d18c86931d752c3a680e84a69df53bc04e7dfd
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
tests: test-swift-upgrades.sh: Drop Ansible verbosity

The upgrade tests are very noisy since Ansible verbosity is set too
high. This makes debugging problems very painful so drop the verbosity
level and let users increase it if desired.

Change-Id: Id256efff664c58d62aaf7b9e23c7df6953032573

commit_message:
Refactor the create port form to workflow

The neutron API allows the users to specify security group(s) when
creating a port [1], but at the moment the Horizon can only modify
the security group of a port by 'Edit Port' row action.

As with edit port workflow, refactoring the creation of port form
to workflow is to support the creation of ports as well as the
assignment of security groups. Since the change may be more, this
patch only contains reconstruct the form, support the security
groups will be submitted in another patch.

[1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/network/v2/index.html#create-port

Change-Id: Ie7e5242cc885b6eb0316f695453b0d2844360d67
Related-bug: #1746985

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-09 09:49:05.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/base.py', 'horizon/decorators.py', 'openstack_dashboard/test/settings.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/766bd2bc56e374a93f377b0cad9fad87f49dc880', 'message': 'Views accessible via url even if user doesn't match policy rules

When a user doesn't match the policy rules of a panel then the panel tab
is removed from the menu of the left, but panel views are still
accessible using directly the url (ex /admin/flavors/).

In most of the case, views won't work correctly because of the lack of

policies.

I think it could be more elegant to return directly a "You are not
authorized to access this page" from the frontend when user try to
access a view of a panel (via url) without matching the policy rules.

Change-Id: Id32e21a90ad33264545bb32fb53cc98ecd4f29b1
Closes-Bug: #1741051
'}]
commit_message:
Views accessible via url even if user doesn't match policy rules

When a user doesn't match the policy rules of a panel then the panel tab
is removed from the menu of the left, but panel views are still
accessible using directly the url (ex /admin/flavors/).

In most of the case, views won't work correctly because of the lack of
right in the backend, but it may cause trouble when you play with
policies.

I think it could be more elegant to return directly a "You are not
authorized to access this page" from the frontend when user try to
access a view of a panel (via url) without matching the policy rules.

Change-Id: Id32e21a90ad33264545bb32fb53cc98ecd4f29b1
Closes-Bug: #1741051

The **new** name, used in both glance and glance_store, is " "``file``" msgstr "" "*File system store operators*: the old name, now **DEPRECATED**, was " "``filesystem``. The **new** name, used in both glance and glance_store, is " "``file``" msgid "" "*VMware datastore operators*: The old name, now **DEPRECATED**, was " "``vmware_datastore``. The **new** name, used in both glance and " "glance_store, is ``vmware``" msgstr "" "*VMware datastore operators*: The old name, now **DEPRECATED**, was " "``vmware_datastore``. The **new** name, used in both glance and " "glance_store, is ``vmware``" msgid "11.0.1" msgstr "11.0.1" msgid "11.0.2" msgstr "11.0.2" msgid "12.0.0" msgstr "12.0.0" msgid "12.0.0-20" msgstr "12.0.0-20" msgid "13.0.0" msgstr "13.0.0" msgid "14.0.0" msgstr "14.0.0" msgid "15.0.0" msgstr "15.0.0" msgid "16.0.0.0b1" msgstr "16.0.0.0b1" msgid "16.0.0.0b3" msgstr "16.0.0.0b3" msgid "" "A new policy, ``tasks_api_access`` has been introduced so that ordinary user " "credentials may be used by Glance to manage the tasks that accomplish the " "interoperable image import process without requiring that operators expose " "the Tasks API to end users." msgstr "" "A new policy, ``tasks_api_access`` has been introduced so that ordinary user " "credentials may be used by Glance to manage the tasks that accomplish the " "interoperable image import process without requiring that operators expose " "the Tasks API to end users." msgid "" "A new value for the Image 'visibility' field, 'community', is introduced." msgstr "" "A new value for the Image 'visibility' field, 'community', is introduced." msgid "" "A new value for visibility, 'shared', is introduced. Images that have or " "can accept members will no longer be displayed as having 'private' " "visibility, reducing confusion among end users." msgstr "" "A new value for visibility, 'shared', is introduced. Images that have or " "can accept members will no longer be displayed as having 'private' " "visibility, reducing confusion among end users." msgid "" "A preview of zero-downtime database upgrades is available in this release, " "but it is **experimental** and **not supported for production systems**. " "Please consult the `Database Management`_ section of the Glance " "documentation for details." msgstr "" "A preview of zero-downtime database upgrades is available in this release, " "but it is **experimental** and **not supported for production systems**. " "Please consult the `Database Management`_ section of the Glance " "documentation for details." msgid "Accept the Range header in requests to serve partial images." msgstr "Accept the Range header in requests to serve partial images." msgid "Add ``ploop`` to the list of supported disk formats." msgstr "Add ``ploop`` to the list of supported disk formats." msgid "Add ``vhdx`` to list of supported disk format." msgstr "Add ``vhdx`` to list of supported disk format." msgid "" "Added additional metadata for CPU thread pinning policies to 'compute-cpu-" "pinning.json'. Use the ``glance_manage`` tool to upgrade." msgstr "" "Added additional metadata for CPU thread pinning policies to 'compute-cpu-" "pinning.json'. Use the ``glance_manage`` tool to upgrade." msgid "" "Adding locations to a non-active or non-queued image is no longer allowed." msgstr "" "Adding locations to a non-active or non-queued image is no longer allowed." msgid "" "Additionally, you will need to verify that the task-related policies in the " "Glance policy.json file are set correctly. These settings are described " "below." msgstr "" "Additionally, you will need to verify that the task-related policies in the " "Glance policy.json file are set correctly. These settings are described " "below." msgid "" "An image with 'community' visibility is available for consumption by any " "user." msgstr "" "An image with 'community' visibility is available for consumption by any " "user." msgid "Bug 1229823_: Handle file delete races in image cache" msgstr "Bug 1229823_: Handle file delete races in image cache" msgid "Bug 1482129_: Remove duplicate key from dictionary" msgstr "Bug 1482129_: Remove duplicate key from dictionary" msgid "Current Series Release Notes" msgstr "Current Series Release Notes" msgid "Ocata Series Release Notes" msgstr "Ocata Series Release Notes" msgid "Pike Series Release Notes" msgstr "Pike Series Release Notes"

commit_message:
Enable more hacking-extensions

This patch enable extensions:
-[H106] Do not put vim configuration in source files.
-[H204] Use assert(Not)Equal to check for equality.
-[H205] Use assert(Greater|Less)(Equal) for comparison.

Change-Id: I7fa2c8753b2b471f44afe8ee83a4a612ed1b76a9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/17/538817/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [H106] Do not put vim configuration in source files. # [H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None. # [H204] Use assert(Not)Equal to check for equality. # [H205] Use assert(Greater|Less)(Equal) for comparison. # [H904] Delay string interpolations at logging calls. enable-extensions=H106,H203,H204,H205,H904
deleted_lines: # H203 Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None # H904 Delay string interpolations at logging calls enable-extensions=H203,H904

commit_message:
Native Zuul v3 jobs

Use the jobs defined by sahara-tests, and force the installation of
the saharaclient code by tuning LIBS_FROM_GIT.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/512058
Change-Id: I33641a575b0529d6ff53ca9cf2b14e7d67d53084

subject: bagpipe-bgp: EVPN OVS driver fixes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-08 11:27:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-bagpipe/commit/a01eb262dd38525c759a1a645c18aad7d89f9ec6', 'message': 'bagpipe-bgp: EVPN OVS driver fixes

This fixes issues not catched by earlier tests.

Change-Id: I7377aa0f7e6422ce8806153518832525fb0e70ff
Related-bug: 1719337
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-02-08 13:38:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-bagpipe/commit/ab5498ccf4a9f7c08f3c4ce9ce5078d602f732b8', 'message': 'bagpipe-bgp: EVPN OVS driver fixes

This fixes issues not catched by earlier tests:
- TunnelManager is shared so "used by" handles need
  to include instance_id's
- need OF1.3 for mod_vlan_vid
- delete_port takes a port id, not a name
- gateway port methods can be empty

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: EVPN OVS driver fixes

This fixes issues not catched by earlier tests:
- TunnelManager is shared so "used by" handles need
  to include instance_id's
- need OF1.3 for mod_vlan_vid
- delete_port takes a port id, not a name
- gateway port methods can be empty

Change-Id: I7377aa0f7e6422ce8806153518832525fb0e70ff
Related-bug: 1719337
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-bagpipe refs/changes/40/542140/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # OpenFlow 1.3 is needed for mod_vlan_vid self.bridge.use_at_least_protocol(ovs_const.OPENFLOW13) def set_gateway_port(self, linuxif, gateway_ip): # nothing to do, because we make the assumption that the # IPVPN driver is 'ovs' as well, and setup in conjunction # with Neutron OVS BGPVPN extension which does the plugging # between L2 and L3 pass def gateway_port_down(self, linuxif): pass self.bridge.delete_port(tunnel)
deleted_lines: def gateway_port_down(self, linuxif): raise Exception("not implemented") def set_gateway_port(self, linuxif, gateway_ip): raise Exception("not implemented") self.bridge.delete_port(tunnel.port_name)

revisions:

commit_message:
Document known issue with galera 10.1.31

Explanation for deployers on how to prevent the 10.1.31 issue.

Change-Id: I97aa26c4761b613c870e31cd82f69e0f07c772a4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/44/542144/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- issues: - | All the deployments done on the Ocata, Pike, and Queens branch before patch X are using mariadb-server 10.1.x. The minor version isn't frozen, and the default repository upstream evolves over time. The latest version, 10.1.31, is victim of clustering issues. To prevent using the 10.1.31 version, you must define the following variables to point to a frozen repository: ``galera_repo_url`` (for galera_server), ``galera_client_repo_url`` (for galera_client). If you want to use the upstream mariadb source still holding the 10.1.30 version, you'd need to set the following variables in your user_variables.yml: For Ubuntu: ``galera_repo_url: https://downloads.mariadb.com/MariaDB/mariadb-10.1.30/repo/ubuntu`` ``galera_client_repo_url: "{{ galera_repo_url }}" `` For CentOS: ``galera_repo_url: https://downloads.mariadb.com/MariaDB/mariadb-10.1.30/yum/centos7-amd64/`` ``galera_client_repo_url: "{{ galera_repo_url }}" `` For OpenSUSE: ``galera_repo_url: https://downloads.mariadb.com/MariaDB/mariadb-10.1.30/yum/opensuse42-amd64`` ``galera_client_repo_url: "{{ galera_repo_url }}" `` If you already have a 10.1.31 package installed, please uninstall it and re-run the ``galera-install.yml`` playbook.

commit_message:
Encode libvirt domain XML in UTF-8

Creating a VM with a non-ASCII name results in an error. Resolve
this by encoding the libvirt domain XML in utf-8.

Co-Authored-By: Yikun Jiang <yikunkero@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1730756
Change-Id: I7afce618deca3baaa96605a6b48c1c2ef4a5f2a5

subject: Tabs in launch server wizard not depending on OPENSTACK_NOVA_EXTENSIONS_BLACKLIST
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-26 09:55:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/b3a4d95232f596b65a05f8acfec1c381f008f9db', 'message': 'Tabs in launch server wizard not depending on OPENSTACK_NOVA_EXTENSIONS_BLACKLIST

OPENSTACK_NOVA_EXTENSIONS_BLACKLIST is used to disable specific extension.
In the launch instance wizard, by example the Server Group tab should be hidden
when the extension "ServerGroups" is blacklisted but it isn't.

It could be interesting to make these tabs dependent of the supported extensions.

commit_message:
Tabs in launch server wizard not depending on OPENSTACK_NOVA_EXTENSIONS_BLACKLIST

OPENSTACK_NOVA_EXTENSIONS_BLACKLIST is used to disable specific extension.
In the launch instance wizard, by example the Server Group tab should be hidden
when the extension "ServerGroups" is blacklisted but it isn't.

It could be interesting to make these tabs dependent of the supported extensions.

Change-Id: I15ea0f1010e3889c217c63e98f1752a4c1ad9ceb
Closes-Bug: #1745367

commit_message:
Tabs in launch server wizard not depending on OPENSTACK_NOVA_EXTENSIONS_BLACKLIST

OPENSTACK_NOVA_EXTENSIONS_BLACKLIST is used to disable specific extension.
In the launch instance wizard, by example the Server Group tab should be hidden
when the extension "ServerGroups" is blacklisted but it isn't.

It could be interesting to make these tabs dependent of the supported extensions.

Change-Id: Ie13229af89598ef322c5ac7a0664fcfdd4720297
Closes-Bug: #1745367

commit_message:
Add native Zuul v3 jobs

The new jobs matches the behavior of the existing jobs.
Most of new jobs are newly defined, and the shared pylint job
is used.

This changes introduces the native versions of:
- tempest tests (API, CLI and clients, unifying two legacy
  jobs);
- scenario tests: basic, py3, modwsgi and multinode.

Multinode is not working for now due to incomplete support in native
Zuul v3 jobs.

tls-proxy is disabled for now, as it produces failures in the job;
previously it was not enabled, so this regression may be old.

Change-Id: Icf22643f17ea0500ceef38f493bd98d49bd9a3bd

commit_message:
trivial: Fix microversion number in test comment

search hypervisor and List servers of hypervisor APIs
have been deprecated in version 2.53:
 I828350c179df8bcfa4739910abeafaba2f96982b

due to multiple rebase during that patch merge,
few unit tests have old microvesion(2.48) in test comment.

Change-Id: I788adee1087d3db4cc0403497e6f10dbfdcaa68c

subject: test_compute_mgr: fix couple of unit tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-01 14:42:37.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/0a538127ad1e7907205b81533388eb4d8c1ea1e2', 'message': 'test_compute_mgr: fix couple of unit tests

_test_shutdown_instance_exception() is a helper function used to
exercise several exceptional paths in _shutdown_instance(). However, if
the "attached_id" property of the mocked BDM is not explicitly set to
None, we won't take the exceptional paths in the function under test.
This patch fixes this by setting attachment_id=None.

Change-Id: I95854d5c0d6663ee2d858755a95694bda84e5973
'}]
commit_message:
test_compute_mgr: fix couple of unit tests

_test_shutdown_instance_exception() is a helper function used to
exercise several exceptional paths in _shutdown_instance(). However, if
the "attached_id" property of the mocked BDM is not explicitly set to
None, we won't take the exceptional paths in the function under test.
This patch fixes this by setting attachment_id=None.

Change-Id: I95854d5c0d6663ee2d858755a95694bda84e5973

with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the

commit_message:
Fix instance dir check when spawning

When spawning instances, we're checking if the instance dir
already exists, in which case we're logging a message, stating
that existing instance files will be reused.

Well, at least that's what we thought we were doing. Actually,
we're always logging this message as the check is wrong.

This change fixes this issue.

Change-Id: I6cf52ae23d90e687103e8bea0b6c4f9eaba6d36c
Closes-Bug: #1747961

commit_message:
Clean imports in code

In some part in the code we import objects. In the Openstack style
guidelines they recommend to import only modules.

https://docs.openstack.org/hacking/0.10.3/

Change-Id: Ie0151c2878c6a0ae09b7efcd5ccc7b31c622c0e7

subject: Fix breaking unit tests due to iso8601 changes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-07 05:10:27.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_utils/timeutils.py', 'oslo_utils/tests/test_timeutils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.utils/commit/1e0570b2a598b43a85faa28e07ab97d56bf5ba5e', 'message': "Fix breaking unit tests due to iso8601 changes

The move from iso8601===0.1.11 to iso8601===0.1.12 broke unit
tests in oslo.utils.

iso8601 used to do:
    from datetime import datetime

But now they call datetime.datetime():
    import datetime
    datetime.datetime()

Unfortunately the unit tests that mocked datetime.datetime() are now
mocking the one in iso8601. This causes a failure in the unit tests.

Fix this by using the 'wraps' argument to mock. So that the calls will
get passed through to datetime.datetime. Also changed to using the
decorator style of mock.

In addition Python 3 unit tests were broken due to changing how the
UTC time zone is represented from 'UTC' to 'UTC+00:00'.

Closes-Bug: #1747575
Closes-Bug: #1744160
Change-Id: Ia80ffb5e571cc5366bef2bc1a32c457a3c16843d
(cherry picked from commit 010fe3b1023871740b57dbc450f80e6c0c0f6e43)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix breaking unit tests due to iso8601 changes

The move from iso8601===0.1.11 to iso8601===0.1.12 broke unit
tests in oslo.utils.

iso8601 used to do:
    from datetime import datetime

But now they call datetime.datetime():
    import datetime
    datetime.datetime()

Unfortunately the unit tests that mocked datetime.datetime() are now
mocking the one in iso8601. This causes a failure in the unit tests.

Fix this by using the 'wraps' argument to mock. So that the calls will
get passed through to datetime.datetime. Also changed to using the
decorator style of mock.

In addition Python 3 unit tests were broken due to changing how the
UTC time zone is represented from 'UTC' to 'UTC+00:00'.

Closes-Bug: #1747575
Closes-Bug: #1744160
Change-Id: Ia80ffb5e571cc5366bef2bc1a32c457a3c16843d
(cherry picked from commit 010fe3b1023871740b57dbc450f80e6c0c0f6e43)

deleted_lines: def _test_is_older_than(self, fn): strptime = datetime.datetime.strptime with mock.patch('datetime.datetime') as datetime_mock: datetime_mock.utcnow.return_value = self.skynet_self_aware_time datetime_mock.strptime = strptime expect_true = timeutils.is_older_than(fn(self.one_minute_before), 59) self.assertTrue(expect_true) expect_false = timeutils.is_older_than(fn(self.one_minute_before), 60) self.assertFalse(expect_false) expect_false = timeutils.is_older_than(fn(self.one_minute_before), 61) self.assertFalse(expect_false) def _test_is_newer_than(self, fn): strptime = datetime.datetime.strptime with mock.patch('datetime.datetime') as datetime_mock: datetime_mock.utcnow.return_value = self.skynet_self_aware_time datetime_mock.strptime = strptime expect_true = timeutils.is_newer_than(fn(self.one_minute_after), 59) self.assertTrue(expect_true) expect_false = timeutils.is_newer_than(fn(self.one_minute_after), 60) self.assertFalse(expect_false) expect_false = timeutils.is_newer_than(fn(self.one_minute_after), 61) self.assertFalse(expect_false)

Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

commit_message:
Remove redundant call to add_instance_fault_from_exc in rebuild_instance

nova.scheduler.utils.set_vm_state_and_notify already calls
add_instance_fault_from_exc so we can remove the redundant call.

The assertion in the test_rebuild_with_image_novalidhost functional
test shows that the fault is still set on the instance.

Change-Id: I8c0074ac7953fe7f777ab23c56ccfa1c26820cc9

commit_message:
tasks: Ensure Open vSwitch is started for all providers that need it

Previously, openvswitch was only started when we were using the ODL
provider but we should start it for all providers that need it. As such
we move the conditional which checks whether Open vSwitch is needed into
a new variable and we use that to start/enable the service and also to
install the package when needed.

Change-Id: I4ec4fc2c2124a941f24478cbdf39ed34c0dce56f

commit_message:
Add support of local CentOS mirrors for quickstart

When running quickstart locally it worth to use local CentOS
mirror for deploying faster.
For using this option you need to export NODEPOOL_CENTOS_MIRROR
variable on your host when you execute quickstart.sh:
Example:
export NODEPOOL_CENTOS_MIRROR=http://mirror.besthosting.ua/
./quickstart.sh ....

Change-Id: I1e472a09682759354122f147b53ba5a84dde12d2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/29/542129/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Increase the Mistral cron_trigger interval

Reducing the frequency of the Mistral cron trigger subsystem greatly reduces
the load that is has on the system. Previously it would query the
database every second, now it will only do this every 10 minutes.

Closes-Bug: #1747386
Depends-On: I6445ff1b6691a098f15e8402ae9d971e751f5552
Depends-On: I9060253bc416be28af4ef81f3edf694059d92066
Change-Id: I18ae5bc0b2192a393959186ba756d1e6a6c62d83

commit_message:

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I399e6c9a90637ee950a94bb53d7fb38817e58a68

Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

commit_message:
emit notifications on notifications_designate

Change I804a34fb044090010ecfd2560594cc1f55e9bd21, commit hash
b89de21d47dc9114d20456452cd867041bcd83c5 dropped notifications_designate
completely to solve a problem described in pad.lv/1738100, however, to
make this change backwards compatible notifications_designate should be
used in addition to "notifications" topic used by default.

This way designate will continue to receive notifications on
notifications_designate from nova, and ceilometer will get notifications
using the "notifications" topic.

Change-Id: I245f5b263994c204a5e521dad542ed83952f54b8
Related-Bug: #1710831
Related-Bug: #1738100

commit_message:
reintroduce designate_notifications topic

Change I709a6aca1843918a67d43bc4808a0013168fbc55, commit hash
1879b16ea543b076c9555fdc0258355d39af9ad0 introduced a
backwards-incompatible change in the fact that designate stopped
consuming messages using designate_notifications topic from nova and
neutron.

While designate.conf change in the mentioned commit is needed to make
sure Designate emits its own notifications on the topic that ceilometer
uses ("notifications"), for nova and neutron to designate notifications
a separate topic should be used as before.

A revert of the previous commit is not done as it addresses the previous
issue but introduces a new one.

Change-Id: I6b5fd1b5f9bae1cd4a1683fd476b456e81d6c79e
Related-Bug: #1710831

subject: Really make the cron trigger execution interval configurable
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-08 14:06:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/mistral/commit/907045561dbc07552fc2caa257df48481a3455e1', 'message': 'Really make the cron trigger execution interval configurable

Note: This is an update to I9060253bc416be28af4ef81f3edf694059d92066,
      which almost worked but due to a race condition with config loading
      the default value may have been used. This delays the decorator
      execution to allow the config to be fully loaded.

The cron_trigger subsystem in Mistral queries the database every second
to look for triggers that require execution. This can be very wasteful
if your deployment only has cron triggers that run infrequently (every
hour or day etc.). Letting operators configure this value reduces the
load and allows the cron triggers to be useful in more scenarios.

Operators do need to be aware that this configuration would limit the
frequency of execution. For example, if the value is set to 600 then cron
triggers configured to run every minute will only run every 10 minutes.

Related-Bug: #1747386
Change-Id: Ia12dcf7fa6b1784be226d223eb89b114c8e4b4f5

commit_message:
Really make the cron trigger execution interval configurable

Note: This is an update to I9060253bc416be28af4ef81f3edf694059d92066,
      which almost worked but due to a race condition with config loading
      the default value may have been used. This delays the decorator
      execution to allow the config to be fully loaded.

The cron_trigger subsystem in Mistral queries the database every second
to look for triggers that require execution. This can be very wasteful
if your deployment only has cron triggers that run infrequently (every
hour or day etc.). Letting operators configure this value reduces the
load and allows the cron triggers to be useful in more scenarios.

Operators do need to be aware that this configuration would limit the
frequency of execution. For example, if the value is set to 600 then cron
triggers configured to run every minute will only run every 10 minutes.

Related-Bug: #1747386
Change-Id: Ia12dcf7fa6b1784be226d223eb89b114c8e4b4f5

LOG.exception( "Failed to process cron trigger %s", str(trigger) ) finally: auth_ctx.set_ctx(None) class MistralPeriodicTasks(periodic_task.PeriodicTasks): def __init__(self, conf): super(MistralPeriodicTasks, self).__init__(conf) periodic_task_ = periodic_task.periodic_task( spacing=CONF.cron_trigger.execution_interval, run_immediately=True, ) self.add_periodic_task(periodic_task_(process_cron_triggers_v2))

However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I4df9e52151483c4539ef701d57b234fbf148728e
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I4df9e52151483c4539ef701d57b234fbf148728e

commit_message:
Revert "Switch the LXD compute driver test to non-voting"

This reverts commit 1aaa6b4449775a6de7bb8f4a0dab3dc69d7b2f57.

Now that we have an upstream library we can use to get the
LXD driver working again, we can make the test voting.

Note that due to the way we execute the tests, the dependent
patch noted below will have to merge before this patch will
pass tests.

Change-Id: I58c9d1bfe49d97a3882a6dd43c9a41a413fe0fab
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/541259

commit_message:
Prep-CI for routed-networks changes

Once we have segments service plug-in enabled and
updated ironic flat interface code we need to set
the physical-network property of the baremetal
ports.

For upgrades this is not required, since the subnet
on the ctlplane network is not associated with a
segment on an undercloud that was upgraded.

Change-Id: I93ffc4fffa18e23e1285cc858cc87356723defc2
Implements: blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-deployment

commit_message:
Remove validate_boot_option_for_trusted_boot metric

This removes the timing metric "validate_boot_option_for_trusted_boot"
because the validate_boot_parameters_for_trusted_boot() function is
an internal function that is called by PXEBoot.validate() -- which
is handled by the "PXEBoot.validate" metric. We shouldn't be emitting
metrics for such short-lived, internal functions.

Change-Id: Iaaa573fc4f128d6c3e20faf9c94259b352874eb8

commit_message:
Remove editor mode setting from goals template

Not everyone uses the same text editors, and it's annoying to have
one person's preferred editor configuration encoded into files meant
for others to edit. Remove the emacs mode variable comment from the
top of the goals template, since not only was it setting someone's
editor preference on a file but doing so on a file meant as an
example for others to copy. If people want to set particular editor
modes automatically, they can do so based on the filename pattern
(we're pretty consistent about setting clear suffixes).

Change-Id: I60932b0a2d86f23de6d80637b04f3c0f76830b70

commit_message:
Rename goals/template.txt to .rst

We expect goal authors to edit goals/template.txt as
reStructuredText and save as a new file with a .rst suffix, so we
should give the template that suffix as well for clarity. Add it to
the exclusion list so that Sphinx won't mind.

Change-Id: Ied69b10a64a715b89cc3ee72f544c8525a25a4d7

release jobs that attempt to publish magnum to pypi fail
due to not having permission with the other magnum project.

commit_message:
Update package name to match pypi name

There is a magnum package registered on pypi, but it is a
different one from this project. This one actually is set
up as openstack-magnum.

There is a 2.0.0 version out there, but that must have been
done manually. With the current name set in setup.cfg,
release jobs that attempt to publish magnum to pypi fail
due to not having permission with the other magnum project.

This changes the package name in setup.cfg to match the
openstack-magnum name so publishing will go to the correct
project.

Change-Id: I210429b34353f2a05e2d1d19afdff18f134aa780

commit_message:
Correct task tag

The 'Check if log dir exists' task is tagged as 'rsyslog_client-install'
but registers a variable that is only used by an 'rsyslog_client-config'
tagged task.

commit_message:
DNM. Testing Mistral Cron Trigger

For the curious - a recent chaned allowed us to limit how frequently
mistral looks for cron triggers that need executed. There was an issue
with it, that should be resolved now (see the depends on). This change
is just being used to verify that in CI. Making this workflow run every
minute, we would expect to see a number of exections (but with the limit
in place we should only see one every 10 mins). CI duration should be
long enough for us to see one or two if it works (or many if there is
still an issue).

This patch will be abandoned afterwards.

Change-Id: I96295d0a01bef404cdf2ca5110e005cca38e7abe
Depends-On: Ia12dcf7fa6b1784be226d223eb89b114c8e4b4f5

Adding the deployment of OVN, this currently depends on multinode. I am
not against the idea of moving this out of multinode if we feel it
should be its on var.

Change-Id: I1ecb53d0d84775a66e13e4b5de29c7a1b51eaf0e

commit_message:
Replace virtualenv-tools by a script

virtualenv-tools has a bug which gets triggered in gates: it can't
change the shebang of a virtualenv python bin/ files if they
were generated with a virtualenv script whose shebang ends with
python2 instead of python.

Because we can't modify virtualenv-tools, we use shell scripts
instead.

Change-Id: I7c4f7acf052989bd0947b0c54e2f539639cf834c
Partial-Bug: #1741634

commit_message:
If debug is enabled, provide verbose output for host discovery

In order to aid debugging, we add the '--verbose' CLI option to
the discovery command. This gives us a little more information
to work with when looking through the logs.

Change-Id: I194a1b20ceba4def8cac9591ef9bf0abf0b7f77f
(cherry picked from commit ec4c2624783328dc755a5090e4843997e630dc3e)

commit_message:
Fixes using SSL OVSDB connection

When creating SSL OVSDB connection it is required to set the private
key, certificate, and the CA certificate in order to communicate with
OVSDB.  This patch configures these when an SSL connection URI is used.
The settings must be provided as part of neutron.conf under [ovs]
section.

Closes-Bug: 1745038

Change-Id: I19fd9dd0c72260835eb91e557a6029ec9d652179
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/83/536983/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import os from oslo_service import sslutilsfrom ovs.stream import Stream if 'ssl:' in conn: sslutils.register_opts(cfg.CONF) priv_key_file = cfg.CONF.ssl.key_file cert_file = cfg.CONF.ssl.cert_file ca_file = cfg.CONF.ssl.ca_file for ssl_file in (priv_key_file, cert_file, ca_file): if not ssl_file: raise Exception("Settings for ssl are required when using ssl " "for ovsdb_connection: key_file, ca_file, " "cert_file") elif not os.path.exists(ssl_file): raise Exception("Specified SSL file not found: {}".format( ssl_file)) Stream.ssl_set_private_key_file(priv_key_file) Stream.ssl_set_certificate_file(cert_file) Stream.ssl_set_ca_cert_file(ca_file)

commit_message:
Revert "RedHat: Ensure that conflicting MariaDB packages are removed"

This patch uninstalls the MySQL server from the system when
it shouldn't be messing about with it as the role manages the
client.

This reverts commit 72cc31a4d6107a69f3d9d5f2bd287112385df1c2.

Change-Id: Ief5cf57e23dfbf9a05aa9051d0ec46d85ac19bbf

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I44f1889047b6ed65fd283b4ee4c4193567d42e03

commit_message:
Pass project_id in dimensions rather than query parameter

This changes resource_id to a resource dimension rather than a function
parameter in monasca collector.

Change-Id: I57e0cecf71743d4c7d66b5210fe831c676d195e1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cloudkitty refs/changes/08/542308/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if project_id: dimensions['project_id'] = project_id dimensions.update(kwargs) resources = self._conn.metrics.list(name=meter, **dimensions)
deleted_lines: dimensions.update(kwargs) if project_id: resources = self._conn.metrics.list(name=meter, tenant_id=project_id, **dimensions) else: resources = self._conn.metrics.list(name=meter, **dimensions)

commit_message:
Remove pip_install dependency

With addition of pip_install on every node, we don't
need to have pip_install as a meta dependency.

Depends-On: If3412bb888ebb854874bbc43eb76bfcb3e4a7868
Depends-On: I79ff70c438b44753be2a93f004ebbc46de0a963d

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-libnetwork refs/changes/77/450677/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ======== Features ======== Supported features ================== kuryr-libnetwork offers the following features: * Docker libnetwork remote driver * Docker libnetwork IPAM driver * Support for Linux Bridge, Open vSwitch, Midonet, and IOvisor port bindings * Support for using existing Neutron networks:: docker network create -d kuryr --ipam-driver=kuryr --subnet=10.10.0.0/24 --gateway=10.10.0.1 \ -o neutron.net.uuid=d98d1259-03d1-4b45-9b86-b039cba1d90d mynet docker network create -d kuryr --ipam-driver=kuryr --subnet=10.10.0.0/24 --gateway=10.10.0.1 \ -o neutron.net.name=my_neutron_net mynet * Support for using existing Neutron ports:: docker run -it --net=kuryr_net --ip=10.0.0.5 ubuntu if a port in the corresponding subnet with the requested ip address already exists and it is unbound, that port is used for the container. * Support for the Docker "expose" option:: docker run --net=my_kuryr_net --expose=1234-1238/udp -it ubuntu This feature is implemented by using Neutron security groups. * Support for using existing Neutron subnetpools * Support port bind drivers for nested-containers Limitations =========== * Docker 1.12 with SwarmKit (the new Swarm) does not support remote drivers. Therefore, it cannot be used with Kuryr. This limitation is to be removed in Docker 1.13.

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I45e8357ad44fb0522dbdf0bbd6ac9f98698e0438
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-memcached_server refs/changes/07/542707/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Consider size of output_on_error

While printing the output of a execution
size of output_on_error is not considered
with the field_size_limit_kb

This patch udpates the function to include
the logical calculation of total size limit

Closes-Bug: #1690316
Change-Id: Icab63d147f580b8d72d8c02b3d9261fd64d3438a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/14/490414/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: str_output_on_error = str(output_on_error) total_output_length = utils.get_length_from_kilobytes( cfg.CONF.engine.execution_field_size_limit_kb) size_output_on_error = len(str_output_on_error) if size_output_on_error < total_output_length: msg = utils.cut_by_char( msg, total_output_length - size_output_on_error ) else: msg = utils.cut_by_kb( msg, cfg.CONF.engine.execution_field_size_limit_kb )

All rights reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import datetime import mock from mistral.db.v2 import api as db_api from mistral.db.v2.sqlalchemy import models from mistral.tests.unit.api import base from mistral.tests.unit.mstrlfixtures import policy_fixtures WF_DEFINITION = """ --- version: '2.0' flow: type: direct input: - param1 tasks: task1: action: std.echo output="Hi" """ WF_DB = models.WorkflowDefinition( id='123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426655440000', name='flow', definition=WF_DEFINITION, created_at=datetime.datetime(1970, 1, 1), updated_at=datetime.datetime(1970, 1, 1), spec={'input': ['param1']} ) WF = { 'id': '123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426655440000', 'name': 'flow', 'definition': WF_DEFINITION, 'created_at': '1970-01-01 00:00:00', 'updated_at': '1970-01-01 00:00:00', 'input': 'param1' } MOCK_WF = mock.MagicMock(return_value=WF_DB) class TestPolicies(base.APITest): @mock.patch.object(db_api, "get_workflow_definition", MOCK_WF) def get(self): resp = self.app.get('/v2/workflows/123', expect_errors=True) return resp.status_int def test_disable_workflow_api(self): self.policy = self.useFixture(policy_fixtures.PolicyFixture()) rules = {"workflows:get": "role:FAKE"} self.policy.change_policy_definition(rules) response_value = self.get() self.assertEqual(403, response_value) def test_enable_workflow_api(self): self.policy = self.useFixture(policy_fixtures.PolicyFixture()) rules = {"workflows:get": "role:FAKE or rule:admin_or_owner"} self.policy.change_policy_definition(rules) response_value = self.get() self.assertEqual(200, response_value)

commit_message:
Tempest: Enable pagination, sorting and project-id API extensions

This patch is enabling the pagination, sorting and project-id API
extensions. Tests that were skipped due to this extensions not being
enabled should now run in gate.

This patch should also fix the following tests that are currently
failing in gate:

neutron_tempest_plugin.api.test_extensions.ExtensionsTest.test_list_extensions_pagination
neutron_tempest_plugin.api.test_extensions.ExtensionsTest.test_list_extensions_project_id
neutron_tempest_plugin.api.test_extensions.ExtensionsTest.test_list_extensions_sorting

Change-Id: I5b2bef6dbb1077834c4a4966af6a0608ad087fc2

commit_message:
Correct task tag

The 'Check if log dir exists' task is tagged as 'rsyslog_client-install'
but registers a variable that is only used by an 'rsyslog_client-config'
tagged task.

Change-Id: I97c3b37a4cc26f0f074f37f992d4764ab75abfdc
(cherry picked from commit 0ee4ebced14e6f8058e4651d80ebac27b9c989fd)

commit_message:
bump client version to meet tacker server needs

This version bump adds reno notes and cluster feature client
for queens release.

the global-requriement can stay on the first version of queens tacker
client.

Mistral and tacker-horizon does not hurt from this upgrade
since they are not using the new features.

Tacker server will include a new feature. If user wants
to use it, he/she will need this newer version of tacker client.

Change-Id: I5bc3d12ba995ea13c45a9d0c0e3a86c2370e176c

Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ib236fc8958c081c51adccc2f671ab90897c28d59

'}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2018-02-08 20:08:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/2441a59f2703b3808946651af22d0d66030ed5c1', 'message': "Allow objects to opt in new engine facade

New facade is enabled by setting new_facade = True for the object of
interest. With new_facade on, all OVO actions will use the new reader /
writer decorator to activate sessions.

There are two facade decorators added to OVO: _facade and
_reader_facade. (To consider: rename that into something more clear /
make public.)

All neutron.objects.db.api helpers now receive OVO classes / objects
instead of model classes, since they need to know which type of engine
facade to use for which object. (To consider: is it an issue for
backwards compatibility?)

This patch also adds several new OVO objects to be able to continue
using neutron.objects.db.api helpers to persist models that previously
didn't have corresponding OVO classes.

Finally, the patch adds registration for missing options in
neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_qos_fip.py to be able to debug
failures in those unit tests. Strictly speaking, this change doesn't
belong to the patch, so: To consider dropping option registration.

There are several non-obvious changes included, specifically:

- in neutron.objects.base, decorator() that refreshes / expunges models
from the active session now opens a subtransaction for the whole span of
call / refresh / expunge, so that we can safely refresh model regardless
of whether caller opened another parent subtransaction (it was not the
case for create_subnetpool in base db plugin code).

- in neutron.db.l3_fip_qos, removed code that updates obj.db_model
relationship directly after corresponding insertions for child policy
binding model. This code is not needed because the only caller to the
_process_extra_fip_qos_update method refetches latest state of floating
ip OVO object anyway, and this code triggers several unit test failures.

Change-Id: I15ec238c18a464f977f7d1079605b82965052311
Related-Bug: #1746996

belong to the patch, but I include it nevertheless to speed up merge in
time close to release.

There are several non-obvious changes included, specifically:

- in neutron.objects.base, decorator() that refreshes / expunges models
from the active session now opens a subtransaction for the whole span of
call / refresh / expunge, so that we can safely refresh model regardless
of whether caller opened another parent subtransaction (it was not the
case for create_subnetpool in base db plugin code).

- in neutron.db.l3_fip_qos, removed code that updates obj.db_model
relationship directly after corresponding insertions for child policy
binding model. This code is not needed because the only caller to the
_process_extra_fip_qos_update method refetches latest state of floating
ip OVO object anyway, and this code triggers several unit test failures.

- unit tests checking that a single commit happens for get_object and
get_objects are no longer valid for new facade objects that use reader
decorator that doesn't commit but close. This change is as intended, so
unit tests were tweaked to check close for new facade objects.

commit_message:
Allow objects to opt in new engine facade

New facade is enabled by setting new_facade = True for the object of
interest. With new_facade on, all OVO actions will use the new reader /
writer decorator to activate sessions.

There are two new facade decorators added to OVO: db_context_reader and
db_context_write that should be used instead of explicit
autonested_transaction / reader.using / writer.using in OVO context.

All neutron.objects.db.api helpers now receive OVO classes / objects
instead of model classes, since they need to know which type of engine
facade to use for which object. While it means we change signatures for
those helper functions, they are not used anywhere outside neutron tree
except vmware-nsx unit tests, and the latter pass anyway because the
tests completely mock out them disregarding their signatures.

This patch also adds several new OVO objects to be able to continue
using neutron.objects.db.api helpers to persist models that previously
didn't have corresponding OVO classes.

Finally, the patch adds registration for missing options in
neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_qos_fip.py to be able to debug
failures in those unit tests. Strictly speaking, this change doesn't
belong to the patch, but I include it nevertheless to speed up merge in
time close to release.

There are several non-obvious changes included, specifically:

- in neutron.objects.base, decorator() that refreshes / expunges models
from the active session now opens a subtransaction for the whole span of
call / refresh / expunge, so that we can safely refresh model regardless
of whether caller opened another parent subtransaction (it was not the
case for create_subnetpool in base db plugin code).

- in neutron.db.l3_fip_qos, removed code that updates obj.db_model
relationship directly after corresponding insertions for child policy
binding model. This code is not needed because the only caller to the
_process_extra_fip_qos_update method refetches latest state of floating
ip OVO object anyway, and this code triggers several unit test failures.

- unit tests checking that a single commit happens for get_object and
get_objects are no longer valid for new facade objects that use reader
decorator that doesn't commit but close. This change is as intended, so
unit tests were tweaked to check close for new facade objects.

Change-Id: I15ec238c18a464f977f7d1079605b82965052311
Related-Bug: #1746996

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Icc8300de4846d407a4090fa24e8ed2bb5f5acfcb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-ops refs/changes/13/541913/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Decouple Image Import Plugin Opts

This change decouples Image Import Plugin Options from glance/opts.py
so that the deployer who wishes to add 3rd party plugin does not
need to inject the details to the file that is cluttered with all
Glance internal details.

Change-Id: Idc31dbb673efae224c97d2cafa4afa053e049c76
Closes-Bug: #1747926

commit_message:
Remove some unused parameters in parameters.yaml

There are no parameter maps to all_tenants, vol_type_id and user_id_1 in
parameters.yaml. So, remove these parameters. Besides, move volume_type
from path to body which is only used by api "Volume manage extension" in
body.

Change-Id: I717e3ab43aeed75e4d9a39f7df3d3c0a72c4aad0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/60/542060/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: all_tenants: description: | Shows details for all projects. in: path required: false type: stringuser_id_1: description: | The user ID. Specify in the URI as ``user_id={user_id}``. in: path required: false type: string vol_type_id: description: | The UUID for an existing volume type. in: path required: true type: stringvolume_type: description: | The ID of Volume Type to be accessed by project. in: path required: false type: string

commit_message:
Update the Tempest plugin to point towards the new plugin

The Trove service has split it's tests for Tempest in a seperate
repo so this patch updates it.

This patch also fixes the lint issue to use the systemd module
reload feature instead of a command.

Closes-Bug: #1747608
Co-Authored-By: Major Hayden <major@mhtx.net>
Depends-On: I5f1ecb71c6125c29d6487bef6c2be215c1b561c1
Change-Id: I26d384a5c9aadade94052cc859f9405335635ed4

subject: Get ResourceGroup/Chain attributes from nested stack outputs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-08 23:20:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/0922ee0261eab8f587fd9e937796cd5a4247d8b9', 'message': "Get ResourceGroup/Chain attributes from nested stack outputs

Since Pike we've generated the templates for various nested stack resource
types with outputs that produce the attribute values that are referenced in
the parent stack, and a previous patch did the same for resource IDs. Use
these output values when available to calculate the attribute values. This
is efficient, because the all of the outputs are fetched together and
cached, and avoids using the grouputils functions that cause the nested
stack to get loaded into memory in the same process.

Fall back to the existing implementation (using grouputils) if the required
output isn't available (generally this would be due to the nested stack
being created on an earlier version of Heat that did not include the
outputs in the generated template, and not updated since).

commit_message:
Get ResourceGroup/Chain attributes from nested stack outputs

Since Pike we've generated the templates for various nested stack resource
types with outputs that produce the attribute values that are referenced in
the parent stack, and a previous patch did the same for resource IDs. Use
these output values when available to calculate the attribute values. This
is efficient, because the all of the outputs are fetched together and
cached, and avoids using the grouputils functions that cause the nested
stack to get loaded into memory in the same process.

Fall back to the existing implementation (using grouputils) if the required
output isn't available (generally this would be due to the nested stack
being created on an earlier version of Heat that did not include the
outputs in the generated template, and not updated since).

Change-Id: I9146e1d99f494213daef7d61ae75c92a4ef981a9

subject: Handle data inconsistency in grouputils
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-07 20:12:19.000000000', 'files': ['heat/common/grouputils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/8963ea885be9abc046081f702d2816f3afec96fd', 'message': "Handle data inconsistency in grouputils

In convergence, retrieving the template for a stack will return the latest
template submitted by the user and accepted to start a traversal. If this
template removes resources from the stack, they may continue to appear as
available when getting a list of current resources even if a definition
for them doesn't appear in the current template.

This occasionally caused a KeyError when trying to match up data from the
nested stack to the nested stack's template in grouputils using the
GroupInspector. Fix this by accounting for the fact that the stack and
template may contain different sets of resources.

Change-Id: I86d80ab766667194f4e6e3b6112d6b1b7a3733d8
Closes-Bug: #1747365
"}]
commit_message:
Handle data inconsistency in grouputils

In convergence, retrieving the template for a stack will return the latest
template submitted by the user and accepted to start a traversal. If this
template removes resources from the stack, they may continue to appear as
available when getting a list of current resources even if a definition
for them doesn't appear in the current template.

This occasionally caused a KeyError when trying to match up data from the
nested stack to the nested stack's template in grouputils using the
GroupInspector. Fix this by accounting for the fact that the stack and
template may contain different sets of resources.

Change-Id: I86d80ab766667194f4e6e3b6112d6b1b7a3733d8
Closes-Bug: #1747365

commit_message:
tests: test-glance-upgrades.sh: Remove the exit trap

We are already collecting logs as part of the post-run playbook so we
don't need to do that as part of the exit trap. This avoid collecting
and compressing the logs twice.

Change-Id: I3b4de14b2e98941c948bc23747b85a1a6286b272
(cherry picked from commit f0c7448fa22e1e35283e57ada4633a9263e671e0)

commit_message:
Adjust deprecated nova console variables

The `vncserver_listen` and `vncserver_proxyclient_address` variables
are now deprecated in queens. This patch updates those variables
to the new versions.

Closes-Bug: 1742705
Change-Id: Ibe2dfdb9c3c41a507c87d6ad34e6415a8a1e1cad

commit_message:
queens: release nova 17.0.0.0rc1

Cycle highlights are added based on the current Queens GA
release notes.

Change-Id: I20d75037900a1a1d345d087b30d5a76176738f69
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/59/542459/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: branches: - location: 17.0.0.0rc1 name: stable/queens - version: 17.0.0.0rc1 projects: - repo: openstack/nova hash: eae37a27caa5ca8b0ca50187928bde81f28a24e1 cycle-highlights: - | The performance of listing instances across a multi-cell cells v2 deployment has been improved and the results are now merge sorted. - | Rescheduling during a server create or resize operation is now supported in a split-MQ multi-cell cells v2 deployment. - | The libvirt compute driver supports volume multi-attach when using the 2.60 compute API microversion. See the Cinder admin guide for more details on volume multi-attach support in Queens. - | Added support for vGPUs. Experimental feature with some caveats, but admins can now define flavors that request vGPU resources. See `admin guide <https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/admin/virtual-gpu.html>_` for more details. - | Traits-based scheduling is now available for the ironic compute driver. For more details, see the `ironic docs for scheduling based on traits <https://docs.openstack.org/ironic/latest/install/configure-nova-flavors.html#scheduling-based-on-traits>`_.
deleted_lines: cycle-highlights: - Added support for vGPUs. Experimental feature with some caveats, but admins can now define flavors that request vGPU resources.

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ie087d2d812b7937f2a1ac45dedb94559ff5113e6

Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

commit_message:
zun: add property mount to container

Change-Id: I5e62d599fff87dd4b9cd26267350e9b4b816b15b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/27/533427/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: HOSTNAME, SECURITY_GROUPS, NETWORKS, MOUNTS, 'hostname', 'security_groups', 'networks', 'mounts', _MOUNT_KEYS = ( VOLUME_ID, MOUNT_PATH, ) = ( 'volume_id', 'mount_path', ) MOUNTS: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.LIST, _('A list of volumes mounted inside the container.'), schema=properties.Schema( properties.Schema.MAP, schema={ VOLUME_ID: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _('The ID or name of the cinder volume mount to ' 'the container'), constraints=[ constraints.CustomConstraint('cinder.volume') ] ), VOLUME_SIZE: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _('The size of the cinder volume to create.'), constraints=[ constraints.CustomConstraint('cinder.volume') ] ), MOUNT_PATH: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _('The filesystem path inside the container'), required=True, ), }, ) ), mounts = self.properties[self.MOUNTS] or [] for mount in mounts: self._validate_mount(mount) def _validate_mount(self, mount): volume_id = mount.get(self.VOLUME_ID) volume_size = mount.get(self.VOLUME_SIZE) if volume_id is None and volume_size is None: msg = _('One of the properties "%(id)s" or "%(size)s" ' 'should be set for the specified mount of ' 'container "%(container)s".' '') % dict(id=self.VOLUME_ID, size=self.VOLUME_SIZE, container=self.name) raise exception.StackValidationFailed(message=msg) # Don't allow specify volume_id and volume_size at the same time if volume_id and volume_size: raise exception.ResourcePropertyConflict( "/".join([self.NETWORKS, self.VOLUME_ID]), "/".join([self.NETWORKS, self.VOLUME_SIZE])) mounts = args.pop(self.MOUNTS, None) if mounts: args[self.MOUNTS] = self._build_mounts(mounts) def _build_mounts(self, mounts): if not mounts: return None mnts = [] for idx, mount in enumerate(mounts): mnt_info = {'source': mount.get(self.VOLUME_ID), 'size': mount.get(self.VOLUME_SIZE), 'destination': mount[self.MOUNT_PATH]} mnts.append(mnt_info) return mnts

commit_message:
Replace random with SystemRandom for RandomString

it might be theoretically possible to infer the state of
standard Python's RNG in a long-running heat-engine service
from multiple created RandomString resources.

Let's use the random.SystemRandom (and os.urandom) for
OS::Heat::RandomString instead.

Change-Id: Iac5c03176fc8bae95ada883621196bd9cb453be3
Closes-Bug: #1745931
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/03/536403/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import random as random_module# NOTE(pas-ha) Heat officially supports only POSIX::Linux platform # where os.urandom() and random.SystemRandom() are available random = random_module.SystemRandom()

commit_message:
Remove ikelifetime in %default section of ipsec.conf templates

Nowadays connections always override the ikelifetime setting in their
own sections. The setting in the %default section is no longer used. So
this commit removes that from the templates as a cleanup.

TrivialFix
Change-Id: I49961cd53d12792486d0b8b0c45ab0e3c6c72484

commit_message:
Add release note for Aggregate[Core|Ram|Disk]Filter change

Related-Bug: #1742827

Change-Id: I01f20f275bbd5451ace5c1e6f41ab38d488dae4e
(cherry picked from commit 1c4d2f4cbdf096cbd79297338cfb40d15875f930)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/90/542290/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- upgrade: - | Starting in Ocata, there is a behavior change where aggregate-based overcommit ratios will no longer be honored during scheduling for the FilterScheduler. Instead, overcommit values must be set on a per-compute-node basis in the Nova configuration files. If you have been relying on per-aggregate overcommit, during your upgrade, you must change to using per-compute-node overcommit ratios in order for your scheduling behavior to stay consistent. Otherwise, you may notice increased NoValidHost scheduling failures as the aggregate-based overcommit is no longer being considered. You can safely remove the AggregateCoreFilter, AggregateRamFilter, and AggregateDiskFilter from your ``[filter_scheduler]enabled_filters`` and you do not need to replace them with any other core/ram/disk filters. The placement query in the FilterScheduler takes care of the core/ram/disk filtering, so CoreFilter, RamFilter, and DiskFilter are redundant. Please see the mailing list thread for more information: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-operators/2018-January/014748.html

subject: Fix wrong link for "Manage Flavors" in CPU topologies doc
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-08 15:49:48.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/admin/flavors.rst', 'doc/source/admin/cpu-topologies.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/307975ae4818ea5a510cfcb01bdb1f37fa563109', 'message': 'Fix wrong link for "Manage Flavors" in CPU topologies doc

Conflicts:

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to a change in Queens
Ia57c93ef1e72ccf134ba6fc7fcb85ab228d68a47 which refactored
where the flavor docs live.

Change-Id: I30f6bc70afc5be00737cdf76e0e47bcb898a3a7f
Closes-Bug: #1747562
(cherry picked from commit 26de90a14d527ae18dd6cd39d4fdf589dd449fb6)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix wrong link for "Manage Flavors" in CPU topologies doc

The last sentence here where it links to "Manage Flavors"
is the wrong link. It goes here:
https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/admin/flavors.html which
doesn't talk about NUMA extra specs. It should be pointing at
the "NUMA topology" section of the flavor extra specs page:
https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/user/flavors.html#extra-specs-numa-topology

commit_message:
Add test for resetting volume's attach status

The API that reset status of volume in fact supports to reset volume's
status, attach_status and migration_status. This patch adds test case
for resetting volume's attach status.

Change-Id: I214b63587648b4ae181e62d497a32ad0f4d8831e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/81/496081/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @decorators.idempotent_id('116f55f0-dbb5-42bf-b619-7f039dd9ee2f') def test_volume_reset_attach_status(self): volume = self.create_volume() self.addCleanup(self.admin_volume_client.reset_volume_status, volume['id'], attach_status='detached') self.admin_volume_client.reset_volume_status( volume['id'], attach_status='attached') volume_get = self.admin_volume_client.show_volume( volume['id'])['volume'] self.assertEqual('in-use', volume_get['status'])

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-06 19:03:54.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/engine.pp', 'spec/classes/heat_engine_spec.rb', 'releasenotes/notes/add_plugin_dirs_parameter-20c755fbdb22c58d.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-heat/commit/75a24e127aa85cbe243d1f38a164b6226f7c8565', 'message': 'Make heat parameter plugin_dirs configurable

commit_message:
Make heat parameter plugin_dirs configurable

Heat has an additional configuration for plugin_dirs
parameter. This parameter provides a list of directories
to search for plug-ins. This change allows configuration
of plugin_dirs parameter in heat.conf file. This change
will allow a user to set this value, if required. Else
$::os_service_default will be used and the parameter will
not be added to the config file, as it is done today.

Change-Id: I636d52f867ee447eaf0e1e80bf9fdc30c91f4ec1
(cherry picked from commit 56cbd7c89bfc99f6a962319f478d75dbf35e8335)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-heat refs/changes/02/541402/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - Heat has additional configuration option for plugin_dirs parameter. This parameter provides a list of directories to search for plug-ins. This change allows configuration of plugin_dirs parameter in heat.conf file.

subject: blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-deployment
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-17 01:45:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-specs/commit/f262fa122e402c200b8ccb7a8fa5db80dca7b0ca', 'message': 'Spec: tripleo-routed-networks-deployment - Routed Spine and Leaf

This spec covers the scope of work required to enable deployment of TripleO
in a routed network environment. A routed network design, also known as
"Spine and Leaf", or "Clos" architecture, allows for horizontal scalability
where each group of servers is inside its own set of layer 2 subnets, and
subnets are connected via routers. This allows for a larger number of total
nodes, since the broadcast, multicast, and unknown unicast (BUM traffic) is
isolated to the local layer 2 domain. Furthermore, equal-cost multipath
(ECMP) can provide better distribution of traffic between multiple uplinks
in large deployments.

There are multiple projects which will need to be enhanced to add features
for routed newtorks. The DHCP services provided by both Neutron and Ironic
Inspector need to be enhanced to provide routers for each subnet. The use
of Neutron as an IP address management (IPAM) backend will need to be
evaluated, to determine if we need features that were added to support
routed networks in Neutron. The TripleO Heat templates will need to be
refactored in order to support multiple subnets. We may need some
enhancements to os-net-config (to be determined).

This spec attempts to break down the overall goals by the problem set as
it applies to each project. Separate blueprints and specs will be used
for each separate project or dependency, the blueprint associated with
this spec will be used to link to them all.

Change-Id: I72861ce8adfeff67b894cf389f7096cde8be9258
